sources.data_found: HiPerGator Hardware Specifications: Lists 'A100 80GB' count as 1,120 (140 DGX nodes) and 128 (32 standard nodes). Also lists 376 RTX 2080 Ti (47 nodes), 68 Quadro RTX 6000 (17 nodes), and 24 Quadro RTX 8000 (3 nodes).
HiPerGator AI: Confirms the deployment of NVIDIA DGX SuperPod with 140 DGX A100 systems.
CISE Department About Page: Lists Fall 2023 Enrollment statistics. Undergraduate: 2,746; Master's: 372; Ph.D.: 194.

student_data.notes: Data sourced directly from the Computer & Information Science & Engineering (CISE) department 'About' page, reflecting Fall 2023 enrollment numbers. Undergrad count includes CS and related majors within the CISE department.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Source lists 17 nodes with 4x Quadro RTX 6000 GPUs. (Distinct from RTX A6000 Ampere).
Source lists 3 nodes with 8x Quadro RTX 8000 GPUs.
Source lists 47 nodes with 8x GeForce RTX 2080 Ti GPUs.

gpu_resources.notes:
HiPerGator 3.0/AI counts calculated from official hardware wiki:
1) AI Partition: 140 DGX A100 nodes x 8 GPUs = 1,120 A100 80GB GPUs.
2) Standard GPU Partition: 32 nodes x 4 A100 GPUs = 128 A100 80GB GPUs.
Total A100 80GB = 1,120 + 128 = 1,248.

Older HiPerGator 2.0 nodes (V100/K80) are listed as retired/migrated or not primary compute resources on the main hardware page.

analysis_notes: University of Florida has one of the largest academic AI clusters (HiPerGator AI). Data for GPU resources is highly centralized on the Research Computing wiki. Student data is explicitly available on the CISE department homepage.
